source: Sayyid Abul Ala Maududi - Tafhim al-Qur'an - The Meaning of the Quran
short_text: The Surah is so designated after the word wal-fajr with which it opens.
text:
The Surah is so designated after the word wal-fajr with which it opens.

Period of Revelation

Its contents show that it was revealed at the stage when persecution of the new converts to Islam had begun in Makkah. On that very basis the people of Makkah have been warned of the evil end of the tribes of Ad and Thamud and of Pharaoh.

Theme and Subject Matter

Its theme is to affirm the meting out of rewards and punishments in the Hereafter, which the people of Makkah were not prepared to acknowledge, Let us consider the reasoning in the order in which it has been presented.

First of all, swearing oaths by the dawn, the ten nights, the even and the odd, and the departing night, the listeners have been asked: "Are these things not enough to testify to the truth of that which you are refusing to acknowledge?" From the explanation that we have given of these four things in the corresponding notes, it will become clear that these things are a symbol of the regularity that exists in the night and day, and swearing oaths by these the question has been asked in the sense: Even after witnessing this wise system established by God, do you still need any other evidence to show that it is not beyond the power of that God Who has brought about this system to establish the Hereafter, and that it is the very requirement of his wisdom that He should call man to account for his deeds?

Then, reasoning from man's own history, the evil end of the Ad and the Thamud and Pharaoh has been cited as an example to show that when they transgressed all limits and multiplied corruption in the earth, Allah laid upon them the scourge of His chastisement. This is a proof of the fact that the system of the universe is not being run by deaf and blind forces, nor is the world a lawless kingdom of a corrupt ruler, but a Wise Ruler is ruling over it, the demand of Whose wisdom and justice is continuously visible in the world itself in man's own history that He should call to account, and reward and punish accordingly, the being whom He has blessed with reason and moral sense and given the right of appropriation in the world.

After this, an appraisal has been made of the general moral state of human society of which Arab paganism was a conspicuous example; two aspects of it in particular, have been criticized: first the materialistic attitude of the people on account of which overlooking the moral good and evil, they regarded only the achievement of worldly wealth, rank and position, or the absence of it, as the criterion of honor or disgrace, and had forgotten that neither riches was a reward nor poverty a punishment, but that Allah is trying man in both conditions to see what attitude he adopts when blessed with wealth and how he behaves when afflicted by poverty. Second, the people's attitude under which the orphan child in their society was left destitute on the death of the father. Nobody asked after the poor; whoever could, usurped the whole heritage left by the deceased parent, and drove away the weak heirs fraudulently. The people were so afflicted with an insatiable greed for wealth that
they were never satisfied however much they might hoard and amass. This criticism is meant to make them realize as to why the people with such an attitude and conduct in the life of the world should not be called to account for their misdeeds.

The discourse has been concluded with the assertion that accountability shall certainly be held and it will be held on the Day when the Divine Court will be established. At that time the deniers of the judgment will understand that which they are not understanding now in spite of instruction and admonition, but understanding then will be of no avail. The denier will regret and say, "Would that I had provided for this Day beforehand while I lived in the world." But his regrets will not save him from Allah's punishment. However, as for the people who would have accepted the Truth, which the heavenly books and the Prophets of God were presenting, with full satisfaction of the heart in the world, Allah will be pleased with them and they will be well pleased with the rewards bestowed by Allah. They will be called upon to join the righteous and enter Paradise.
description: The surah that opens with the oath of the Divine One swearing by The Dawn, and other natural occurrences and sacred designations, as a means of categorical airmation to mankind that God shall, indeed, hold all people accountable. It is names after “the dawn” (al-fajr) mentioned in verse 1. A surah in which God emphasizes that the tyrants of the Prophet’s time will be like those He dealt with in the past. The surah compares the destiny of the ungrateful with that of the souls at peace.The surah is also known as: The Daybreak.

Efendi Nahi.verse 89:3: dhe në të gjitha që janë çift e tek,
Efendi Nahi.verse 89:5: vallë, a nuk është ky betim për të mençurin?
Efendi Nahi.verse 89:6: Vallë, a nuk di ti se çka ka bërë Zoti yt me Adin,
Efendi Nahi.verse 89:7: e me banorët e qytetit Iremes, pronarë të pallatee madhështore,
Efendi Nahi.verse 89:8: çfarë nuk ka pasur askund tjetër;
Efendi Nahi.verse 89:9: dhe si i dënoi themudasit, të cilët kanë gëdhendur shkëmbinj në luginë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 89:11: që kanë bërë zullum pa të drejtë në tokë
Efendi Nahi.verse 89:13: andaj Zoti yt, e lëshoi mbi ta kamxhikun e dënimit (lloj-lloj dënimesh),
Efendi Nahi.verse 89:14: sepse, me të vërtetë, Zoti yt i pret ata në pusi (i përcjellë punët e tyre).
Efendi Nahi.verse 89:15: Por, Perëndia kur ta provojë njeriun e ta dhurojë me begati, (ai) thotë: “Zoti im është sjellë në mënyrë bujar endaj meje!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 89:16: E, kur ta provojë atë, duke ia munguar furnizimin, atëherë ai thotë: “Zoti im më ka poshtëruar”.
Efendi Nahi.verse 89:17: Jo, jo! Por ju nuk po i respektoni bonjakët,
Efendi Nahi.verse 89:18: dhe nuk po e nxitni njëri-tjetrin për t’i ushqyer të varfërit,
Efendi Nahi.verse 89:19: kurse trashëgiminë, e hani me lakmi të pangopur,
Efendi Nahi.verse 89:21: Por kjo nuk është mirë! Atëherë, kur Toka do të copëtohet në thërmia,
Efendi Nahi.verse 89:22: dhe kur do të arrijë urdhëri i Zotit tënd, e engjëjt të rreshtohen radhë pas radhe,
Efendi Nahi.verse 89:23: dhe atë Ditë kur afrohet (prezentohet) skëterra; atëherë njeriu do të kujtohet – por ç’dobi?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 89:24: dhe thotë: “Ah! Sikur të kisha punuar gjëra të mira në jetën time!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 89:25: Atë Ditë, askush nuk mund të dënojë, si Ai (dënimi i Tij),
Efendi Nahi.verse 89:26: dhe, atë ditë, askush nuk lidhë në pranga si Ai!
Efendi Nahi.verse 89:27: E ti, o shpirt i besuar (këmbëngulës në besim)
Efendi Nahi.verse 89:28: kthehu te Zoti yt i kënaqur, sepse, edhe Ai është i kënaqur me ty,
Efendi Nahi.verse 89:29: prandaj, hynnë mes të dashurve të Mi,
Efendi Nahi.verse 89:30: dhe hyn në xhennetin Tim! Mi,

null.verse 89:2: And olsun on gecəyə (zülhiccə ayının birinci, yaxud ramazan ayının sonuncu on gecəsinə);
null.verse 89:3: And olsun cütə və təkə (tək olan xaliqə, erkək və dişi olmaqla cüt olan məxluqata; cüt olan hər şeyə, yaxud Qurban bayramına və yaxud Ərəfə gününə);
null.verse 89:4: And olsun keçib getməkdə olan gecəyə (ki, qiyamət haqdır və siz kafirlər qiyamət günü dirilib əməllərinizin cəzasını layiqincə alacaqsınız)!
null.verse 89:5: Məgər bunlarda (qiyamətin haq olması barədə) ağıl sahibi üçün and yoxmudur?!
null.verse 89:6: (Ya Peyğəmbər!) məgər görmədinmi ki, Rəbbin nələr etdi Ada (Hud peyğəmbərin Ad qövmünə)?!
null.verse 89:7: Sütunlar sahibi (və ya: sütun kimi uca boylu) İrəmə (İrəm camaatına)?!
null.verse 89:8: (Elə bir qövm ki) məmləkətlər (əhli) arasında onun kimisi yaradılmamışdı.
null.verse 89:9: (Məgər görmədinmi ki, Rəbbin nələr etdi) vadidə qayaları olan Səmuda (Səmud qövmünə)?!
null.verse 89:10: Eləcə də saysız-hesabsız ordular sahibi Fir'ona?!
null.verse 89:11: O kəslər ki, məmləkətlərdə tüğyan edir,
null.verse 89:13: Nəhayət, Rəbbin onlara əzab qamçısı endirdi.
null.verse 89:14: Şübhəsiz ki, Rəbbin (bəndələrinin bütün əməllərini) baxıb görür.
null.verse 89:15: İnsana gəldikdə, nə zaman Rəbbin onu imtahana çəkib ehtiram etsə, ona bir ne'mət versə, o: "Rəbbim mənə ehtiram göstərdi!"-deyər.
null.verse 89:16: Amma nə zaman (Rəbbin) onu imtahana çəkib ruzisini əskiltsə: "Rəbbim məni alçaltdı (mənə xor baxdı)!" - söyləyər.
null.verse 89:17: Xeyr! (Belə deməyin).
null.verse 89:18: Bir-birinizi yoxsulu yedirtməyə rəğbətləndirmirsiniz.
null.verse 89:19: Mirası (halal-haramına) varmadan yeyirsiniz (qadınların, uşaqların paylarını vermirsiniz).
null.verse 89:20: Mal-dövləti isə lap çox sevirsiniz.
null.verse 89:21: Xeyr! Yer dağılıb parça-parça olacağı;
null.verse 89:22: Rəbbinin əmri gəlib mələklər səf-səf duracağı
null.verse 89:23: Və Cəhənnəmin (məhşər meydanına) gətiriləcəyi gün - məhz o gün insan (öz günahlarını) xatırlayacaqdır.
null.verse 89:24: O: "Kaş ki, mən əvvəlcədən (axirət) həyatım üçün (yaxşı əməllər) edəydim!" - deyəcəkdir.
null.verse 89:25: O gün (Allahın) etdiyi əzabı heç kəs edə bilməz!
null.verse 89:26: (Günahkarları) heç kəs Onun kimi zəncirləyə bilməz!
null.verse 89:27: (Qiyamət günü Allah-təala mö'min kimsəyə belə buyuracaqdır: ) "Ey (öz imanından, əməlindən və Allahın və'dindən) xatircəm olan kəs! (Və ya: "Ey arxayın nəfs!")
null.verse 89:28: Dön Rəbbinə, sən Ondan razı olaraq, O da səndən!
null.verse 89:29: (Əməlisaleh) bəndələrimin zümrəsinə daxil ol!
null.verse 89:30: (Onlarla birlikdə) Cənnətimə varid ol!"

null.verse 89:4: i noći kada nestaje -
null.verse 89:5: zar to pametnom zakletva nije.
null.verse 89:6: Zar ne znaš šta je Gospodar tvoj sa Adom uradio,
null.verse 89:7: sa stanovnicima Irema, punog palata na stupovima,
null.verse 89:8: kojima ravna ni u jednoj zemlji nije bilo;
null.verse 89:9: i Semudom, koji je stijene u dolini klesao,
null.verse 89:10: i faraonom, koji je šatore imao -
null.verse 89:11: koji su na Zemlji zulum provodili
null.verse 89:13: pa je Gospodar tvoj - bič patnje na njih spustio,
null.verse 89:14: jer, Gospodar tvoj je, zaista, u zasjedi.
null.verse 89:15: Čovjek, kada Gospodar njegov hoće da ga iskuša pa mu počast ukaže i blagodatima ga obaspe, rekne: "Gospodar moj je prema meni plemenito postupio!"
null.verse 89:16: A kad mu, da bi ga iskušao, opskrbu njegovu oskudnom učini, onda rekne: "Gospodar moj me je napustio!"
null.verse 89:17: A nije tako! Vi pažnju siročetu ne ukazujete,
null.verse 89:18: i da se puki siromah nahrani - jedan drugog ne nagovarate,
null.verse 89:19: a nasljedstvo pohlepno jedete
null.verse 89:20: i bogatstvo pretjerano volite.
null.verse 89:21: A ne valja to! Kada se Zemlja u komadiće zdrobi
null.verse 89:22: i kad dođe naređenje Gospodara tvoga, a meleki budu sve red do reda,
null.verse 89:23: i kad se tog Dana primakne Džehennem; tada će se čovjek sjetiti - a na što mu je sjećanje?! -
null.verse 89:24: i reći: "Kamo sreće da sam se za ovaj život pripremio!"
null.verse 89:25: Tog Dana niko neće kao On mučiti,
null.verse 89:26: i niko neće kao On u okove okivati!
null.verse 89:27: A ti, o dušo smirena,
null.verse 89:28: vrati se Gospodaru svome zadovoljna, a i On tobom zadovoljan,
null.verse 89:29: pa uđi među robove Moje,
null.verse 89:30: i uđi u Džennet Moj! Moje,

null.verse 89:4: এবং শপথ রাত্রির যখন তা গত হতে থাকে
null.verse 89:5: এর মধ্যে আছে শপথ জ্ঞানী ব্যক্তির জন্যে।
null.verse 89:6: আপনি কি লক্ষ্য করেননি, আপনার পালনকর্তা আদ বংশের ইরাম গোত্রের সাথে কি আচরণ করেছিলেন,
null.verse 89:7: যাদের দৈহিক গঠন স্তম্ভ ও খুঁটির ন্যায় দীর্ঘ ছিল এবং
null.verse 89:8: যাদের সমান শক্তি ও বলবীর্যে সারা বিশ্বের শহরসমূহে কোন লোক সৃজিত হয়নি
null.verse 89:9: এবং সামুদ গোত্রের সাথে, যারা উপত্যকায় পাথর কেটে গৃহ নির্মাণ করেছিল।
null.verse 89:10: এবং বহু কীলকের অধিপতি ফেরাউনের সাথে
null.verse 89:11: যারা দেশে সীমালঙ্ঘন করেছিল।
null.verse 89:12: অতঃপর সেখানে বিস্তর অশান্তি সৃষ্টি করেছিল।
null.verse 89:13: অতঃপর আপনার পালনকর্তা তাদেরকে শাস্তির কশাঘাত করলেন।
null.verse 89:14: নিশ্চয় আপনার পালকর্তা সতর্ক দৃষ্টি রাখেন।
null.verse 89:15: মানুষ এরূপ যে, যখন তার পালনকর্তা তাকে পরীক্ষা করেন, অতঃপর সম্মান ও অনুগ্রহ দান করেন, তখন বলে, আমার পালনকর্তা আমাকে সম্মান দান করেছেন।
null.verse 89:16: এবং যখন তাকে পরীক্ষা করেন, অতঃপর রিযিক সংকুচিত করে দেন, তখন বলেঃ আমার পালনকর্তা আমাকে হেয় করেছেন।
null.verse 89:17: এটা অমূলক, বরং তোমরা এতীমকে সম্মান কর না।
null.verse 89:18: এবং মিসকীনকে অন্নদানে পরস্পরকে উৎসাহিত কর না।
null.verse 89:19: এবং তোমরা মৃতের ত্যাজ্য সম্পত্তি সম্পূর্ণরূপে কুক্ষিগত করে ফেল
null.verse 89:20: এবং তোমরা ধন-সম্পদকে প্রাণভরে ভালবাস।
null.verse 89:21: এটা অনুচিত। যখন পৃথিবী চুর্ণ-বিচুর্ণ হবে
null.verse 89:22: এবং আপনার পালনকর্তা ও ফেরেশতাগণ সারিবদ্ধভাবে উপস্থিত হবেন,
null.verse 89:23: এবং সেদিন জাহান্নামকে আনা হবে, সেদিন মানুষ স্মরণ করবে, কিন্তু এই স্মরণ তার কি কাজে আসবে?
null.verse 89:24: সে বলবেঃ হায়, এ জীবনের জন্যে আমি যদি কিছু অগ্রে প্রেরণ করতাম!
null.verse 89:25: সেদিন তার শাস্তির মত শাস্তি কেউ দিবে না।
null.verse 89:26: এবং তার বন্ধনের মত বন্ধন কেউ দিবে না।
null.verse 89:27: হে প্রশান্ত মন,
null.verse 89:28: তুমি তোমার পালনকর্তার নিকট ফিরে যাও সন্তুষ্ট ও সন্তোষভাজন হয়ে।
null.verse 89:29: অতঃপর আমার বান্দাদের অন্তর্ভুক্ত হয়ে যাও।
null.verse 89:30: এবং আমার জান্নাতে প্রবেশ কর। যাও।

Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 89:2: и в десетте нощи [от месеца за поклонение хадж],
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 89:3: и в четното, и в нечетното,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 89:5: Нима в това няма клетва за разумния?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 89:6: Не видя ли ти как постъпи твоят Господ с адитите
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 89:7: и с ирамитите, имащи високи постройки,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 89:8: подобни на които не бяха сътворени по земите,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 89:9: и със самудяните, които изсичаха скалите в долината,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 89:10: и с Фараона, владетеля на войските,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 89:13: Тогава твоят Господ стовари върху тях бича на мъчението.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 89:15: И ако неговият Господ го подложи на изпитание, като го почете и облагодетелства, човекът казва: Моят Господ ме почете.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 89:16: А ако го подложи на изпитание, като ограничи препитанието му, казва: Моят Господ ме оскърби.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 89:17: Ала не! Вие не почитате сирака
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 89:18: и не подканвате да бъде нахранен нуждаещият се,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 89:19: и изяждате наследството [дори ако е чуждо] с лакомия.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 89:20: И обичате богатството с голяма любов.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 89:21: Ала не! Когато земята бъде стрита на прах
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 89:22: и твоят Господ дойде с подредените в редици ангели,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 89:23: и Адът бъде докаран в този Ден, човекът ще си спомни тогава, ала защо ще му е спомнянето?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 89:24: Ще казва: О, да бях сторил отнапред добрини заради моя
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 89:26: В този Ден никой друг не ще измъчва, както Той измъчва,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 89:27: и никой друг не ще оковава, както Той оковава.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 89:29: завърни се при твоя Господ доволстваща, заслужила благосклонност!

null.verse 89:4: 與離去的黑夜，
null.verse 89:5: 對於有理智者，此中有一種盟誓嗎？
null.verse 89:6: 難道你不知道你的主怎樣懲治阿德人——
null.verse 89:7: 有高柱的伊賴姆人嗎？
null.verse 89:8: 像那樣的人，在別的城市裡還沒有被創造過的——
null.verse 89:9: 怎樣懲治在山谷裡鑿石為家的賽莫德人，
null.verse 89:10: 怎樣懲治有武力的法老。
null.verse 89:11: 這等人曾在國中放肆，
null.verse 89:13: 故你的主把一種刑罰，傾注在他們身上。
null.verse 89:14: 你的主，確是監視的。
null.verse 89:15: 至於人，當他的主考驗他，故優待他，而且使他過安逸生活的時候，他說：「我的主優待我了。」
null.verse 89:16: 當他考驗他，故節約他的給養的時候，他說：「我的主凌辱我了。」
null.verse 89:17: 絕不然！但你們不優待孤兒，
null.verse 89:18: 你們不以濟貧相勉勵，
null.verse 89:19: 你們侵吞遺產，
null.verse 89:20: 你們酷愛錢財。
null.verse 89:21: 絕不然！當大地震動復震動，
null.verse 89:22: 你的主的命令，和排班的天神，同齊來臨的時候，
null.verse 89:23: 在那日，火獄將被拿來；在那日，人將覺悟，但覺悟於他有何裨益呢？
null.verse 89:24: 他將說：「但願我在世的時候曾行善事。」
null.verse 89:25: 在那日，任何人，不用他的那種刑罰懲治別人；
null.verse 89:26: 任何人，不用他的那種束縛束縛別人。
null.verse 89:27: 安定的靈魂啊！
null.verse 89:28: 你應當喜悅地，被喜悅地歸於你的主。
null.verse 89:29: 你應當入在我的眾僕裡；
null.verse 89:30: 你應當入在我的樂園裡。 你應當入在我的眾僕裡；

null.verse 89:4: a při noci, když ubíhá!
null.verse 89:5: Což není v tom pro člověka rozvážného přísaha?
null.verse 89:6: Neviděls, co učinil Pán tvůj ´Ádovcům
null.verse 89:7: Iramu, jenž proslul sloupy svými,
null.verse 89:8: jimž nic podobného nebylo stvořeno v žádné zemi,
null.verse 89:9: a kmeni Thamúd, jenž skály v údolí prorážel,
null.verse 89:10: a Faraónovi, který na kůly narážel,
null.verse 89:11: a těm, kdož v zemích vzpurní byli
null.verse 89:12: a pohoršení v nich pak šířili?
null.verse 89:13: Však Pán tvůj proti nim důtky trestající rozpoutal,
null.verse 89:14: neb Pán tvůj neustále na číhané stál.
null.verse 89:15: Co člověka se týče, když Pán jeho jej zkoušce podrobuje a štědrosti a dobrodiním jeho zahrnuje, pak on hovoří: "Pán můj mi poctu prokazuje.
null.verse 89:16: Když naopak jej zkouší tím, že příděl obživy mu odměřuje, pak on hovoří: "Pán můj mě ponižuje.
null.verse 89:17: Však pozor! Vždyť vy sirotky nectíte,
null.verse 89:18: ani k nakrmení nuzných se navzájem nevybízíte
null.verse 89:19: však dědictví slabých nenasytně pohlcujete
null.verse 89:20: a jen bohatství v lásce vášnivé máte.
null.verse 89:21: Však pozor! Až země bude rozdrcena ranou za ranou
null.verse 89:22: a přijde Pán tvůj i andělé, řada za řadou,
null.verse 89:23: a až v ten den bude peklo předvedeno, tehdy si člověk připomene - však co bude mu připomínání platno?
null.verse 89:24: I zvolá: "Kéž bych měl na život budoucí něco předem připraveno!"
null.verse 89:25: V ten den takovým trestem nebude nikdo potrestán
null.verse 89:26: a nikdo takovými okovy spoután!
null.verse 89:27: A ty, duše usmířená,
null.verse 89:28: vrať se k Pánu svému v zalíbení a spokojená!
null.verse 89:29: Vstup mezi služebníky mé
null.verse 89:30: a vejdi do zahrady mé! mé

null.verse 89:3: En het even en het oneven
null.verse 89:4: En de nacht als deze vervaagt;
null.verse 89:5: Daarin is zeker genoeg bewijs voor een man van begrip.
null.verse 89:6: Weet gij niet hoe uw Heer met de Aad handelde?
null.verse 89:7: Het volk van Iram dat verheven gebouwen bezat,
null.verse 89:8: Wier gelijken nog in geen enkele stad zijn voortgebracht,
null.verse 89:9: En met de Samoed die de rotsen in het dal uithieuwen?
null.verse 89:10: En met de farao, de heer der grote scharen?
null.verse 89:11: Die zich in de steden aan overtreding overgaven.
null.verse 89:13: Daarom, deed uw Heer een roede der kastijding over hen nederdalen.
null.verse 89:14: Voorwaar, uw Heer is waakzaam.
null.verse 89:15: Wat de mens betreft, wanneer zijn Heer hem beproeft door hem te roemen en door hem gunsten te bewijzen, dan zegt hij: "Mijn Heer heeft mij geëerd.
null.verse 89:16: Maar wanneer Hij hem beproeft door hem in zijn levensonderhoud te beperken, zegt hij: "Mijn Heer heeft mij onteerd.
null.verse 89:17: Neen, maar gij ontziet de wees niet.
null.verse 89:18: Noch spoort elkander aan, de armen te voeden,
null.verse 89:19: En gij verslindt het erfdeel in zijn geheel
null.verse 89:20: En gij houdt te veel van weelde.
null.verse 89:21: Neen, wanneer de aarde aan stukken wordt geschud,
null.verse 89:22: En uw Heer komt en de engelen in rijen gerangschikt zijn,
null.verse 89:23: Op die Dag zal de hel (hem) worden getoond; op die Dag zal de mens de vermaning willen volgen, maar hoe zal de vermaning hem kunnen baten?
null.verse 89:24: Hij zal zeggen: "O had ik (vroeger), voor dit leven iets verricht.
null.verse 89:25: Niemand straft zoals Hij op die Dag zal straffen.
null.verse 89:26: Noch boeit iemand zoals Hij zal boeien.
null.verse 89:27: Maar gij, o ziel in vrede!
null.verse 89:28: Keer tot uw Heer terug, verblijd in God’s welbehagen.
null.verse 89:29: Ga daarom in onder Mijn dienaren,
null.verse 89:30: En ga Mijn paradijs binnen.

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 89:3: And the Even and the Odd,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 89:4: And the night when it departeth,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 89:5: There surely is an oath for thinking man.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 89:6: Dost thou not consider how thy Lord dealt with (the tribe of) A’ad,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 89:8: The like of which was not created in the lands;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 89:9: And with (the tribe of) Thamud, who clove the rocks in the valley;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 89:10: And with Pharaoh, firm of might,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 89:11: Who (all) were rebellious (to Allah) in these lands,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 89:13: Therefore thy Lord poured on them the disaster of His punishment.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 89:14: Lo! thy Lord is ever watchful.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 89:15: As for man, whenever his Lord trieth him by honouring him, and is gracious unto him, he saith: My Lord honoureth me.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 89:16: But whenever He trieth him by straitening his means of life, he saith: My Lord despiseth me.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 89:17: Nay, but ye (for your part) honour not the orphan
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 89:18: And urge not on the feeding of the poor.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 89:19: And ye devour heritages with devouring greed.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 89:20: And love wealth with abounding love.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 89:21: Nay, but when the earth is ground to atoms, grinding, grinding,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 89:22: And thy Lord shall come with angels, rank on rank,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 89:23: And hell is brought near that day; on that day man will remember, but how will the remembrance (then avail him) ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 89:24: He will say: Ah, would that I had sent before me (some provision) for my life!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 89:25: None punisheth as He will punish on that day!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 89:26: None bindeth as He then will bind.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 89:27: But ah! thou soul at peace!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 89:28: Return unto thy Lord, content in His good pleasure!

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 89:4: And by the Night when it passeth away;-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 89:5: Is there (not) in these an adjuration (or evidence) for those who understand?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 89:6: Seest thou not how thy Lord dealt with the ’Ad (people),-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 89:7: Of the (city of) Iram, with lofty pillars,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 89:8: The like of which were not produced in (all) the land?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 89:9: And with the Thamud (people), who cut out (huge) rocks in the valley?-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 89:10: And with Pharaoh, lord of stakes?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 89:11: (All) these transgressed beyond bounds in the lands,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 89:13: Therefore did thy Lord pour on them a scourge of diverse chastisements:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 89:14: For thy Lord is (as a Guardian) on a watch-tower.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 89:15: Now, as for man, when his Lord trieth him, giving him honour and gifts, then saith he, (puffed up), "My Lord hath honoured me.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 89:16: But when He trieth him, restricting his subsistence for him, then saith he (in despair), "My Lord hath humiliated me!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 89:17: Nay, nay! but ye honour not the orphans!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 89:18: Nor do ye encourage one another to feed the poor!-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 89:19: And ye devour inheritance - all with greed,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 89:20: And ye love wealth with inordinate love!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 89:21: Nay! When the earth is pounded to powder,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 89:22: And thy Lord cometh, and His angels, rank upon rank,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 89:23: And Hell, that Day, is brought (face to face),- on that Day will man remember, but how will that remembrance profit him?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 89:24: He will say: "Ah! Would that I had sent forth (good deeds) for (this) my (Future) Life!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 89:25: For, that Day, His Chastisement will be such as none (else) can inflict,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 89:26: And His bonds will be such as none (other) can bind.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 89:27: (To the righteous soul will be said:) "O (thou) soul, in (complete) rest and satisfaction!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 89:28: "Come back thou to thy Lord,- well pleased (thyself), and well-pleasing unto Him!

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 89:3: by the even and the odd,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 89:4: by the night when it journeys on!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 89:5: Is there in that an oath for a mindful man?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 89:6: Hast thou not seen how thy Lord did with Ad,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 89:8: the like of which was never created in the land,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 89:9: and Thamood, who hollowed the rocks in the valley,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 89:10: and Pharaoh, he of the tent-pegs,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 89:11: who all were insolent in the land
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 89:13: Thy Lord unloosed on them a scourge of chastisement;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 89:14: surely thy Lord is ever on the watch.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 89:15: As for man, whenever his Lord tries him, and honours him, and blesses him, then he says, ’My Lord has honoured me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 89:16: But when he tries him and stints for him his provision, then he says, ’My Lord has despised me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 89:17: No indeed; but you honour not the orphan,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 89:18: and you urge not the feeding of the needy,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 89:19: and you devour the inheritance greedily,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 89:20: and you love wealth with an ardent love
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 89:21: No indeed! When the earth is ground to powder,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 89:22: and thy Lord comes, and the angels rank on rank,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 89:23: and Gehenna is brought out, upon that day man will remember; and how shall the Reminder be for him?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 89:24: He shall say, ’O would that I had forwarded for my life!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 89:25: Upon that day none shall chastise as He chastises,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 89:26: none shall bind as He binds.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 89:28: return unto thy Lord, well-pleased, well-pleasing!

Muhammad Asad.verse 89:3: Consider the multiple and the One!
Muhammad Asad.verse 89:4: Consider the night as it runs its course!
Muhammad Asad.verse 89:5: Considering all this – could there be, to anyone endowed with reason, a
Muhammad Asad.verse 89:7: ART THOU NOT aware of how thy Sustainer has dealt with [the tribe of] ’ād,
Muhammad Asad.verse 89:9: the like of whom has never been reared in all the land? –
Muhammad Asad.verse 89:10: and with [the tribe of] Thamūd, who hollowed out rocks in the valley? –
Muhammad Asad.verse 89:13: [It was they] who transgressed all bounds of equity all over their lands,
Muhammad Asad.verse 89:14: and brought about great corruption therein:
Muhammad Asad.verse 89:15: and therefore thy Sustainer let loose upon them a scourge of suffering:
Muhammad Asad.verse 89:16: for, verily, thy Sustainer is ever on the watch!
Muhammad Asad.verse 89:17: BUT AS FOR man, whenever his Sustainer tries him by His generosity and by letting him enjoy a life of ease, he says, "My Sustainer has been
Muhammad Asad.verse 89:19: whereas, whenever He tries him by straitening his means of livelihood, he says, "My Sustainer has disgraced me!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 89:20: But nay, nay, [O men, consider all that you do and fail to do:] you are not generous towards the orphan,
Muhammad Asad.verse 89:21: and you do not urge one another to feed the needy,
Muhammad Asad.verse 89:22: and you devour the inheritance [of others] with devouring greed,
Muhammad Asad.verse 89:23: and you love wealth with boundless love!
Muhammad Asad.verse 89:24: Nay, but [how will you fare on Judgment Day,] when the earth is crushed with crushing upon crushing,
Muhammad Asad.verse 89:25: and [the majesty of] thy Sustainer stands revealed, as well as [the true nature of] the angels, rank upon rank?
Muhammad Asad.verse 89:26: And on that Day hell will be brought [within sight]; on that Day man will remember [all that he did and failed to do]: but what will that remembrance avail him?
Muhammad Asad.verse 89:27: He will say, "Oh, would that I had provided beforehand for my life [to come]!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 89:28: For none can make suffer as He will make suffer [the sinners] on that Day,
Muhammad Asad.verse 89:29: and none can bind with bonds like His.
Muhammad Asad.verse 89:30: [But unto the righteous God will say,] "O thou human being that hast attained to inner peace!
Muhammad Asad.verse 89:31: Return thou unto thy Sustainer, well-pleased
Muhammad Asad.verse 89:33: enter, then, together with My [other true] servants –
Muhammad Asad.verse 89:36: thy Sustainer comes,” which almost all of the classical commentators understand as the revelation (in the abstract sense of this word) of God’s transcendental majesty and the manifestation of His judgment.

Martin Lings.verse 89:8: unto they Lord with (in) gladness that is thine in Him and His in thee.
Martin Lings.verse 89:12: unto thy Lord, pleased thou and whelmed in His good pleasure.
Martin Lings.verse 89:13: Return unto thy Lord gladly and accepted in mutual gladness.

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 89:3: and by the even and the odd,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 89:4: and by the night when it moves away,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 89:5: -Is there (not) in such an oath (enough assurance) for a man of sense?-
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 89:6: Have you not seen how your Lord dealt with (the people) of ‘Ād
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 89:7: of Iram , the men of tall pillars,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 89:8: the like of whom were never created in the lands,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 89:9: and (how He dealt) with (the people of) Thamūd who had carved out the rocks in the Valley (of Qurā),
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 89:10: and with Fir‘aun (Pharaoh), the man of the stakes,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 89:11: - those who had rebelled in the cities,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 89:12: and spread a lot of mischief therein.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 89:13: So, your Lord let loose on them the whip of torment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 89:14: Surely your Lord is ever on the watch.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 89:15: As for man, when his Lord tests him, and thus gives him honour and bounties, he says, “My Lord has honoured me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 89:16: But when he tests him, and thus straitens his provision for him, he says, “My Lord has disgraced me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 89:17: No! But you do not honour the orphan,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 89:18: and do not encourage one another to feed the needy.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 89:19: And you devour the inheritance with a sweeping gulp,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 89:20: and love wealth, an excessive love.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 89:21: No! When the earth will be crushed thoroughly to be turned into bits,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 89:22: and your Lord will come, and the angels as well, lined up in rows,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 89:23: and Jahannam (Hell), on that day, will be brought forward, it will be the day when man will realize the truth, but from where will he take advantage of such realization?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 89:24: He will say, “O Would that I had sent ahead (some good deeds) for (this) my life!”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 89:25: So no one can punish like He will punish, that day,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 89:26: nor can anyone shackle like He will shackle.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 89:27: (As for an obedient man, it will be said to him,) “O content soul,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 89:28: come back to your Lord, well-pleased, well-pleasing.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 89:1: By the emerging dawn (that dispels the darkness of night),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 89:3: And by the even and the odd,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 89:4: And by the night as it departs.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 89:5: Surely, in that is a mighty oath for the wise.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 89:6: Have you not seen how your Lord treated (the people of ‘Ad)?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 89:7: (They) were (the people) of Iram (and) were (tall like) lofty columns (possessing towering castles),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 89:8: The like of which has not (at all) been created in the countries (of the world).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 89:9: And (what treatment was given to) Thamud, who carved rocks (and constructed hundreds of cities) in the (Qura) valley?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 89:10: And (how was) Pharaoh (dealt with), who wielded large armies (and used to punish victims with stakes)?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 89:11: (They were) the people who perpetrated tyranny in their (respective) countries,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 89:12: And spread great mischief and corruption there.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 89:13: Then your Lord unleashed the scourge of punishment on them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 89:14: Indeed, your Lord is Ever-Watchful (over the tyrant transgressors).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 89:15: But as for man, when his Lord tests him (by providing him pleasure and comfort) and honours him and gives him bounties, he says: ‘My Lord has honoured me.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 89:16: But when He tries him (by afflicting him with pain and discomfort) and limits his means of sustenance, he says: ‘My Lord has humiliated me.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 89:17: No indeed! But (the truth is that after you gain honour and good fortune), you do not give honour and care to orphans.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 89:18: Nor do you inspire one another (in society) to promote the feeding of the destitute (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 89:19: And you lay hand on the inherited wealth and devour it (yourselves and do not pay the poverty-stricken their due).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 89:20: And you love wealth and riches inordinately.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 89:21: Assuredly, when the earth will be cleft asunder and crushed to dust particles,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 89:22: And your Lord will unveil His Light and the angels will appear (before His presence) rank upon rank,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 89:23: And that Day, Hell will be brought forth.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 89:24: He will say: ‘Would that I had sent (something) ahead of me for my (real) life (which would have helped me Today)!’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 89:25: But that Day no one will be able to torment like His torment,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 89:26: And no one will be able to bind as He binds.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 89:28: Return to your Lord in such a state that you are both the aspirant to, and the aspired of, His pleasure (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 89:30: And enter My Paradise (of nearness and sight).

null.verse 89:5: Eikö tässä kaikessa ole minkä nimeen vannoa, jos kuka sen tajuaa?
null.verse 89:6: Etkö ole miettinyt sitä, mitä Herrasi teki Aadille
null.verse 89:7: ja Aramin heimolle, jonka rakennuksia tukivat ylväät pilarit,
null.verse 89:8: sellaiset, joiden vertaisia ei rakennettu muissa kaupungeissa,
null.verse 89:9: (ja mitä tehtiin) Tamuudin kansalle, joka laaksossaan hakkasi asumuksensa suunnattomiin kallioihin
null.verse 89:10: ja faraolle, sotajoukkojen valtiaalle,
null.verse 89:11: noille kaikille,jotka harjoittivat irstaisuutta kaupungeissaan
null.verse 89:13: Sentähden Herrasi lähetti heille kurituksen;
null.verse 89:14: totisesti Herrasi seuraa valppaasti teidänkin menoanne.
null.verse 89:15: Kun ihmisen Herra koettelee häntä antamalla hänelle kunniaa ja osoittamalla hänelle hyvyyttä, niin hän sanoo: »Herra pitää minut kunniassa.
null.verse 89:16: Mutta kun Hän koettelee häntä toisin, niukentaen hänen elatustaan, silloin hän sanoo: »Herra halveksii minua.
null.verse 89:17: Ei, te ette pidä orpoa missään arvossa
null.verse 89:18: ettekä kehoita toisianne ruokkimaan köyhiä,
null.verse 89:19: vaan te syötte olemattomiin kaikki heidän perintönsä ettekä mistään pidä väliä ahmiessanne,
null.verse 89:20: ja te rakastatte ylellisyyttä koko sydämestänne.
null.verse 89:21: Ei, kun tärähdykset panevat maan luhistumaan,
null.verse 89:22: kun Herra ilmestyy enkeliparvien seuraamana
null.verse 89:23: ja paljastaa helvetin, sinä päivänä ihminen noudattaisi kehoitusta, mutta miksi hyödyksi on hänelle totteleminen enää?
null.verse 89:24: Hän sanoo: »Voi, jospa olisin huolehtinut tulevasta elämästäni!»
null.verse 89:25: Mutta tuona päivänä ei kukaan rankaise niinkuin Hän,
null.verse 89:26: ei kukaan sido niinkuin Hän.
null.verse 89:27: Sinä levon löytänyt sielu,
null.verse 89:28: palaa Herrasi luo saadaksesi Hänestä lohtusi ja ollaksesi Hänelle otollinen,
null.verse 89:29: astu siis Minun palvelijoitteni joukkoon,
null.verse 89:30: Niin, astu autuuden tarhaan!

Jean-Louis Michon.verse 89:4: Par la nuit quand elle s'écoule !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 89:5: N'est-ce pas là un serment pour qui est doué d'intelligence ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 89:6: N'as-tu pas vu comment ton Seigneur a agi envers les 'Ad
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 89:7: et Iram, [la cité] aux colonnades dont
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 89:8: nul autre exemple ne fut jamais créé dans le pays,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 89:9: et envers les Thamoud qui taillèrent le roc dans la vallée
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 89:10: et envers Pharaon et ses piliers,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 89:11: envers tous ceux qui se sont montrés rebelles dans le pays
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 89:12: et y ont intensifié la corruption ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 89:13: Ton Seigneur abattit sur eux le fouet du châtiment.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 89:14: Certes, ton Seigneur se tient aux aguets.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 89:15: Quant à l'homme, lorsque son Seigneur, pour l'éprouver, l'honore et le comble de bienfaits, il dit : " Mon Seigneur m'a honoré ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 89:16: Mais quand, pour l'éprouver, Dieu lui mesure Ses dons, il dit : " Mon Seigneur m'a humilié ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 89:17: Mais non ! Vous n'honorez pas l'orphelin ;
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 89:18: vous ne vous incitez pas mutuellement à nourrir le pauvre ;
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 89:20: vous aimez les richesses d'un amour sans bornes.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 89:21: Mais non ! Quand la terre sera réduite en poudre,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 89:22: et que ton Seigneur viendra, ainsi que les anges rangée par rangée :
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 89:23: ce Jour-là, on amènera la Géhenne ; ce Jour-là, l'homme se souviendra.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 89:24: Il dira : " Malheur à moi ! Puissé-je avoir fait une avance pour ma vie
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 89:26: Ce Jour-là, nul autre que Dieu ne châtiera comme Lui,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 89:27: et nul autre que Dieu ne chargera de chaînes comme Lui.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 89:29: Retourne vers ton Seigneur, agréante et agréée ;

Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 89:4: Et par la nuit quand elle s’écoule !
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 89:5: N’est-ce pas là un serment, pour un doué d’intelligence ?
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 89:6: N’as-tu pas vu comment ton Seigneur a agi avec les Aad
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 89:8: Iram , [la cité] à la colonne remarquable,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 89:9: dont jamais pareille ne fut construite parmi les villes ?
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 89:10: et avec les Tamud qui taillaient le rocher dans la vallée ?
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 89:11: ainsi qu’avec Pharaon, l’homme aux épieux ?
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 89:12: Tous, étaient des gens qui transgressaient dans
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 89:14: et y avaient commis beaucoup de désordre.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 89:15: Donc, ton Seigneur déversa sur eux un fouet du châtiment.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 89:16: Car ton Seigneur demeure aux aguets.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 89:17: Quant à l’homme, lorsque son Seigneur l’éprouve en l’honorant et en le comblant de bienfaits, il dit : «Mon Seigneur m’a honoré».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 89:18: Mais par contre, quand Il l’éprouve en lui restreignant sa subsistance, il dit : «Mon Seigneur m’a avili».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 89:19: Mais non ! C’est vous plutôt, qui n’êtes pas généreux envers les orphelins;
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 89:20: qui ne vous incitez pas mutuellement à nourrir le pauvre,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 89:21: qui dévorez l’héritage avec une avidité vorace,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 89:22: et aimez les richesses d’un amour sans bornes.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 89:23: Prenez garde ! Quand la terre sera complètement pulvérisée,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 89:24: et que ton Seigneur viendra ainsi que les Anges, rang par rang,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 89:25: et que ce jour-là, on amènera l’Enfer; ce jour-là, l’homme se rappellera.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 89:26: Il dira : «Hélas ! Que n’ai-je fait du bien pour ma vie future !
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 89:27: Ce jour-là donc, nul ne saura châtier comme Lui châtie,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 89:28: et nul ne saura garrotter comme Lui garrotte.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 89:30: retourne vers ton Seigneur, satisfaite et agréée;

null.verse 89:4: Und der Nacht, wenn sie vergeht;
null.verse 89:5: Hierin ist wahrlich ausreichender Beweis für einen Verständigen.
null.verse 89:6: Hast du nicht gesehen, wie dein Herr mit den Àd verfuhr,
null.verse 89:7: Dem Volk von Iram, Besitzer von hohen Burgen,
null.verse 89:8: Dergleichen nicht erschaffen ward in (anderen) Städten,
null.verse 89:9: Und den Thamüd, die die Felsen aushieben im Tal,
null.verse 89:10: Und Pharao, dem Herrn von gewaltigen Zelten?
null.verse 89:11: Die frevelten in den Städten,
null.verse 89:13: Drum ließ dein Herr die Peitsche der Strafe auf sie fallen.
null.verse 89:14: Wahrlich, dein Herr ist auf der Wacht.
null.verse 89:15: Wenn sein Herr den Menschen prüft, indem Er ihn ehrt und Gnaden auf ihn häuft, dann spricht er: «Mein Herr hat mich geehrt.
null.verse 89:16: Wenn Er ihn aber prüft, indem Er ihm seine Versorgung verkürzt, dann spricht er: «Mein Herr hat mich erniedrigt.
null.verse 89:17: Nein, doch ihr ehrt nicht die Waise
null.verse 89:18: Und treibet einander nicht an, den Armen zu speisen,
null.verse 89:19: Und ihr verzehrt das Erbe (anderer) ganz und gar,
null.verse 89:20: Und ihr liebt den Reichtum mit unmäßiger Liebe.
null.verse 89:21: Nein, wenn die Erde zu Staub zermalmt wird;
null.verse 89:22: Und dein Herr kommt und (auch) die Engel, in Reihen gereiht;
null.verse 89:23: Und die Hölle nahegebracht wird an jenem Tage.
null.verse 89:24: Er wird sprechen: «O hätte ich doch im voraus für (dieses) mein Leben Vorsorge getroffen!»
null.verse 89:25: Keiner kann strafen, wie Er an jenem Tage strafen wird.
null.verse 89:26: Und keiner bindet so fest, wie Er festbinden wird.
null.verse 89:27: (Doch) du, o beruhigte Seele,
null.verse 89:28: Kehre zurück zu deinem Herrn, befriedigt in (Seiner) Zufriedenheit!
null.verse 89:29: So tritt denn ein unter Meine Diener,
null.verse 89:30: Und tritt ein in Meinen Garten! Diener,
